Avulsion.definition: a sudden cutting off of land by flood or change in the course of a body of water ;esp
Avulsion.origin: [Latin avulsio act of tearing away, from avellere to tear away, from a - off, away + vellere to pull, pluck]

1.1: a sudden cutting off of land by flood or change in the course of a body of water

2.1: one that separates a portion from one person's property and joins it to the property of another compare
